website_summaries.verdict: Altra Paradigm 3.0 generated a mixed response from its users. While the neutral running shoe provided excellent comfort and higher flexibility, some people believed that it could certainly use an improvement in its overall look and design for better durability and a firmer hold.
pros: Most customers were of the opinion that the shoe was highly comfortable
The wide-footed runners found its toe-box sufficiently roomy
The testers admitted that the outsole showed minimal signs of wear, even after many miles of running
The customers admired the impressively soft and breathable upper
A few runners mentioned that the shoe needed no ‘breaking in’
they were able to do many miles in these shoes straight out of the box
One user commented that it was easy to transition through the gait cycle running in the Altra Paradigm 3.0, owing to the pair’s enhanced flexibility
cons: Some customers thought that the overall look of the shoe was rather ‘boring’
A number of users found durability issues with the Paradigm 3’s outsole after several miles of running
The toe-box was rather narrow, a few runners observed
A tester thought that the shoe’s design made it very difficult to clean after some dirt was stuck in it

customer_reviews.title: Sizing runs small
customer_reviews.text: When I bought these, I got them 1/2 size larger than I normally wear, and they were still too small. I ran in them anyway, as it wasn't a real problem unless I went down hills. I just bought the v4.5 Paradigms, and they're sized exactly as they should be. The quality is also better in the v4.5 shoes. I would not recommend the v3.5 shoes unless you get a killer deal and order them a bit larger than you normally do. The attached photo shows the v4.5 on the left and the v3.5 on the right, with both toes against the wall.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Kalla

customer_reviews.title: Okay for regular width feet.
customer_reviews.text: No longer a wide toe box. They fit like a regular width shoe, where the older shoes were wide with their idea of your toes splaying. I have wide feet, so I always liked these with the zero drop and wide. I'm glad they have some better color options. I've had the Paradigm shoes before and felt like I had to pick a color that I didn't really like.
customer_reviews.author: Keith T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe
customer_reviews.text: Super cushiony. The upper is getting better, much better padding that before but still a work in progress. I luv the current heel design and I hope they leave them alone at this point. It does seem smaller (same size on tag) than my prior Altra Paradigms. I order a half size up but they fit and measure exactly as my last pair (2.0's), so you may want to upsize.
customer_reviews.author: jesse nimmer

customer_reviews.title: 5 is more comfortable but yet plenty stable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a half size up and that was a wise choice. I am a 10 but the 10.5 is more comfortable but yet plenty stable. Admittedly I did not buy these to run. Rather, I wear them when i am going to be on my feet all day and they have delivered! They are worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: IknewThenWhatIKnowNow

customer_reviews.title: Knee relief
customer_reviews.text: Continuing my health journey one slow step at a time. I used to wear Skechers shape-ups for my knees, but after they were phased out I had to find replacements. The cushioning on these shoes make me cry with relief. I have bought 4 pairs, because I don't want a repeat of my skechers debacle. I wear a women's size 12, but these run small, so I have bought men's size 11.5 They work well.
customer_reviews.author: Maxiegraphie

customer_reviews.title: Toe box is seems smaller
customer_reviews.text: I rotate between the Paradigm 3.0 and Torin 3.0. I’m an average runner who puts in about 10 miles a week. The Torin 3.0 seem to have a roomier toe box than the Paradigm 3.0. Unfortunately I just got them and have only one run in them (3 miles). Now it doesn’t seem like I can return them for a slightly bigger size because they aren’t new. I like Altra and this is my fourth pair (Instinct 2.0 and two pair of Torin 3.0) so I’ll just deal with it unless someone wants to contact me.
customer_reviews.author: Orville Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Narrow in the heel and midfoot.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a woman with wide feet - I tried women’s Altras and they were so incredibly narrow! So I gave the men’s shoes a shot, and found them to also be far too constricting in the midfoot and heel (albiet better than the womens line.) Bottom line: if you have a narrow heel and midfoot, these may work great for you! Otherwise, steer clear. I hope that Altra expands their line in the future to accommodate more foot shapes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, but if you have had previous versions ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, but if you have had previous versions of the Paradigm, be sure to order a 1/2 size larger in the 3.0's
customer_reviews.author: Ernest C Rosenbaum III

customer_reviews.title: good but tread is not lasting
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoes, but I think they run a bit small. Unfortunately the treads are shredding at a quick pace, but that might be partially my fault because I am not straight-line running in them but using them at work, which requires a lot of twisting on pavement while getting in and out of my car. Very wide footbed, which I really liked.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Brewers

customer_reviews.title: bad Altra Experience
customer_reviews.text: foam in heel of shoe is bad. Altra is currently moving locations and has new policies coming out. They will not warranty their products through them. But,.... they asked me to send pictures before ping ponging me away. I told them I wasn't happy and I'm reflecting in my ratings.
customer_reviews.author: MAP

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have been told to get a pair of these for awhile but was holding out because I have run with ASICS for years. I loved these shoes from the moment I put them on, owned them for a week and have 20 ish miles in them, I will definitely buy another pair when these are wore out. The have plenty of cushion so they impact of running does hurt my knees. I have 4E feet and the wide toe design makes it so my toes are squished in the front of the shoe. Recommend these shoes to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Always a Challenge to Get the Correct Size
customer_reviews.text: Altra continues to befuddle me with their sizing. I wear an 11(2E) normally and own three pairs of different model Altras. Sometimes their 12 fits. Sometimes, it's a 12.5+ (like these). It's never close to an 11, that's for sure. I just hate the hassle of having to go back and forth seeking the correct size. Bottom line - Roll the dice for their comfy shoes that run VERY small - plus or minus.
customer_reviews.author: Watts

customer_reviews.title: It's all I wear now.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a shoe that you can buy at any big box store. It has a wide toe box which fits your foot naturally. Nothing is cramped and it will probably be the best feeling shoe you have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Martygraw

customer_reviews.title: Stitching coming apart after being worn only 10 times!
customer_reviews.text: Even though I had bought these several months ago, I only started wearing them one month ago. Now the stitching at the bottom of the tongue at the toe box is coming apart. Can these be replaced under the manufactures warranty?
customer_reviews.author: MK+

customer_reviews.title: If you like the model....
customer_reviews.text: ...buy it, and several more, because next year's model (same name - new number) may not fit the same. I now have several pair of Paradigm 3.0, because Paradigm 4.0 had a changed shape especially at the instep. Cushioning felt different, as well.
customer_reviews.author: bk

customer_reviews.title: The padding sucks
customer_reviews.text: I love Altra running shoes, but this pair is killing my feet, & my knees. The reason being is because they were poorly made. My right foot feels like it is coming out of the shoe, the reason being, is because the padding on the right shoe is displaced causing that feeling. I’m returning these shoes & going to order a different pair. Hopefully the next pair isn’t like this one. If it is, I’ll have to return & buy another brand. Very disappointed in Altra, especially when you pay so much & have to return it because it was made poorly.
customer_reviews.author: melissa chaparro

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my torn meniscus
customer_reviews.text: I've been difficulties jogging due to torn meniscus. I've been using the Altra Escalante and they helped me a lot, however the sole is thin, very comfortable but thin so I decided to get these Altra. They are exactly what I needed it. My back pain and knee pain has gone almost completely. I feel my strides are more secure and bouncier giving me a better performance without putting too much strain on my knees. I love them
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size shipped
customer_reviews.text: Ordered size 9.5. Outside of box said 9.5. However the shoes were 8.5-seemed small and looked on the show tongue label and verified they were 8.5. Stupid mistake by Amazon-now have to wait for replacement as well as return these shoes. Obviously someone who could not read put the wrong pair of shoes into the box. Get it right Amazon-we trust you not to make stupid errors like this.
customer_reviews.author: Sad_Papa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cushioning and the large toe box is essential for ...
customer_reviews.text: Altras are not the only running shoe I wear. Excellent cushioning and the large toe box is essential for people like me . . . or just people in general. Why make a toe box that narrows instead of being shaped like one's foot? This is a great innovation in running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: triathlondude

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little small
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a great running shoe for the money. Though it runs small in length. I tried a 9.5 which is my standard size but it felt more like a 9. I recommend a half size larger. Did not try to run with them. Bought another brand since a 10 in this shoe the price increased by $40.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schutz

customer_reviews.title: On the Run
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made shoe and extremely comfortable. I use them for road running 2 to 3 times per week. My only complaint is that they could use more cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: NittanyLion

customer_reviews.title: Love This Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: These are such a GREAT SHOE I have used them for over 3 years now. They give amazing support. I work over 8 hours a day standing on cement and any other shoe I crush over 1-2 months I only weigh 140. But these shoes are great! I love the toe box so comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Little Jo

customer_reviews.title: 210) I absolutely love these. The amount of support while still offering ...
customer_reviews.text: As a heavier runner (5”10, 210) I absolutely love these. The amount of support while still offering great agility, is absolutely perfect. I was experiencing some serious foot pain from my Brooks Neuro’s, which also cost way more. As soon as I switched to these, the pain vanished. Would recommend for the heavier guys who have foot pain and run on road surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great for tired feet
customer_reviews.text: These are unusual shoes, but the better for it. I selected them because the company takes tired feet seriously. I stand up all day and these are comfortable and make it so my feet don't hurt all day. My son the shoe expert recommended these and he was right. There are the best shoes I have now.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Gill

customer_reviews.title: Altra is the best running shoe out there.
customer_reviews.text: Best shoes I’ve ever run in. I hate that Altra updated the shoes to the 4.0 but found the 3.0 on amazon and had to purchase an extra pair before I can’t get them anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dolihite

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes, they are very comfortable on my wide feet. I bought this pair to replace an earlier model of the same shoe, which lasted way past the average 300 miles that running shoes are supposed to last. I can't say enough about them, they are a great zero-drop shoe!
customer_reviews.author: John Sieracki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazingly comfortable shoes—I love them. The toe box is roomy and the sole is luxuriously cushioned. Just what my ailing feet needed.
customer_reviews.author: GY

customer_reviews.title: Be careful about the fit.
customer_reviews.text: Heel is looser that the Altra Instinct series so I'm concerned about blisters and the heel cup wearing out. Otherwise, it has more cushioning than the Instinct series so my walk felt better. However, while the wide front is a major win for the big toe, the little toe is still squeezed a bit.
customer_reviews.author: ignoramus

customer_reviews.title: Great for Wide Toe Box
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I need a wide toe box, and these shoes have a natural fit for wide feet. The zero-drop feature improves stride, and the cushioning is "medium" and very comfortable compared to my other shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Two Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfully comfortable! Way better than the Hoka’ I tried on! I did 8 miles the first time I wore them and was ready to do 8 more!!!
customer_reviews.author: G. Randy Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these for a 100 Miles now, and am pleased. I usually buy Altra but have recently switch to training a hard packed dirt road. These things have really made a difference. Will always buy Altra but would will consider these one again
customer_reviews.author: Ian Chancellor

customer_reviews.title: The shoe also leans bad to one side like the stability of the shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: With only 25 miles on the shoe it makes a loud squeaking sound when I walk. The shoe also leans bad to one side like the stability of the shoe is broken. I loved my Paradigm 2’s but this is a horrible shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had a gif of me running with pillows on my feet. These shoes are awesome. I run about 15 miles a week and these shoes work great.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Large Toe Box and Zero drop!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been running in Altras now for over a year and really love them. This particular shoe seems more rugged than other models. They feel like walking on a cloud!
customer_reviews.author: J. Pange

customer_reviews.title: Excellent low / zero drop shoes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent low / zero drop shoes. Best thing about the shoe is the big toe box at the front. Really trains your calf muscles and prevents blisters on those toes. I also have a pair of Clifton 3's and although they are great and lightweight, the tight toebox on the Cliftons tend to create blisters. I alternate between the Altras and the Cliftons and its wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Plush ride from another excellent Altra offering
customer_reviews.text: Softest ride of any Altra I own, but I could have gone up a half size. I wear 9.5 in every one of their shoes but I may prefer a 10 next time in this model. And there will certainly be a next time. Great shoe
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size up
customer_reviews.text: Never in my life have I worn size 15 but apparently that’s what Altra size I wear. Mostly I’m either 13 or 14.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Burkholz

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his shoes! He hasn't had a comfortable pair he could wear all day for years! They are spendy, but the comfort level is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: I'll always love running a good trail
customer_reviews.text: A few years post 5th metatarsal stress fracture I've finally found a shoe I can run on with my forefoot strike on pavement. I'll always love running a good trail, but the convenience of being able to begin a run at my front steps, and not having to drive to my run spot is undeniably preferred on most days. Busy busy.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel E Winke

customer_reviews.title: First impression: excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I have been dealing with a sore foot for some time now. Have changed to different shoes such as new balance and Nike. My foot was still hurting. I wore these Altra shoes one day and by the end of my 8 hour day, it was feeling 90% better. I could also get back to my baseline at the gym on that same day. My husband has seen a podiatrist who recommended him the shoe and in turn he recommends it to me and I’m glad he did.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley B

customer_reviews.title: Love them❤️
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 pairs of Altra❤️ Love them all! 63 year old and trying to find something comfortable for exercise and running. Perfect❤️
customer_reviews.author: LeeBoB DoucetRippey

customer_reviews.title: Rides like a dream
customer_reviews.text: Nice and plush. Better toe box than the 2.0 a little bit better. Used to get a sore knee with running. After two weeks with this shoe and the extra cushion I no longer have the irritation. I Put in 18-22 miles a week. So for people that put in bigger and longer runs they should feel the difference even more. Great fit. Great cushion.
customer_reviews.author: jim bob

customer_reviews.title: Great cushioned road shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great cushioned road shoe. I prefer these over the Torin 2.0s, and I think the sole will last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: OCM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes
customer_reviews.text: If you like cushy shoes, you've got to try these. I use them to walk. They're awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: they look good and fit just fine
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this shoes, he has plantar fasciitis, so comfort has to a number one priority, they look good and fit just fine
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these kicks!! This is my 4th pair of Paradigms. Did not disappoint once again!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better 3.0
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They fit great and are very comfortable. The new model is much more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Okone1

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. Super comfy. Nice cushion. Altra is always my husbands go to shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kammē Oler

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but quality questionable.
customer_reviews.text: The heel tab broke the first time that I put on the shoes. It wasn't properly sewn to the shoe. They are great shoes but I am peeved about the tab.
customer_reviews.author: Duke Hillard

customer_reviews.title: Now that they decided to cover the bottom of the shoe completely with tread, I ordered a pair.
customer_reviews.text: 9/11 Update: Noticed this evening that the tread started separating from the shoe. We are talking about 6 weeks of normal usage. No running or trail running, walking dogs and random daily activity. Now that they decided to cover the bottom of the shoe completely with tread, I ordered a pair. Lots of improvements to the shoe from previous version I owned. The main issue with the shoe was durability due to partially exposed sole. Now that the issue has been fixed I have nothing but praise. Give them a try, you wont be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: These are super comfortable but maybe a little too soft for running.
customer_reviews.author: lcj0811

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, not quite as great as last model.
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty low-volume shoes, especially in the mid- and fore-foot. I don't need the added "passive support." But overall, I think these are a good shoe, and I love the extra padding from the Torin. I wish they kept the 2.0, which was a great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: RDK

customer_reviews.title: Saved my feet!
customer_reviews.text: I keep ordering these over and over. Good cushioning and support. I am a woman that orders men's sizing because they are wide enough. I am a nurse and on my feet all day. These shoes are a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: deanna andrews

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Was having all kinds of issues running on pavement. These shoes have eliminated that. I will definitely be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The fit is perfect. I feel like I’m walking on a cloud. Very happy I purchased these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe
customer_reviews.text: Hands down better than version 2. Did a 10 mile run straight out of the box. Altra hit a home run with this version.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A.

customer_reviews.title: Different than last version
customer_reviews.text: A little narrower than last version. Cushioning seems to be the same or better. Like that the rubber sole covers the outside of the foot unlike last year. Still can’t imagine wearing anything else unless it keeps getting narrow
customer_reviews.author: Hector I Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Best my feet have felt after a run in years.
customer_reviews.text: Best my feet have felt after a run in years. The fit is a bit snug in the midsole, for me, but otherwise they fit as expected. Loosening the laces took care of the snugness in the middle. The benefits of zero drop with the comfort of some cushioning. Great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: BigTex

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sure miss the gaiter trap and wouldn’t buy this shoe again for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: pete sandel

customer_reviews.title: Human Foot Shaped! Seems like a no brainer!
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoe I've tried...I have flat wide feet and these fit my foot shape well. They are cushy yet supportive. Great for walkin. I have not run much in them yet, They seem to be helping heal my plantar fasciitis .
customer_reviews.author: Laurie N

customer_reviews.title: The fit and comfort of these shoes is amazing. They are my absolute favorite shoes
customer_reviews.text: The fit and comfort of these shoes is amazing. They are my absolute favorite shoes. The soles are so well cushioned is like walking or jogging on a gymnastic floor.
customer_reviews.author: J McCain

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Out of 6 pairs of Alta’s that I’ve owned this is the first disappointment. Narrow feeling toe box, odd fit, and poor durability.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Runyan

customer_reviews.title: Completed a few 20+ mile runs and they’ve held up ...
customer_reviews.text: Completed a few 20+ mile runs and they’ve held up well. Definitely purchase 1/2 size larger than previous versions of this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Failure in the Sole.
customer_reviews.text: Have had several pairs of Altras. But both pairs of these paradigms failed on the outside edge of both shoes so both shoes do not support the outside of my foot. Plus I only use the shoes for walking...........
customer_reviews.author: C. Verge

customer_reviews.title: Toe box
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have a large toe box and they are extremely comfortable for people with wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Not just for runners
customer_reviews.text: I have bad knees and needed a shoe that would allow me to walk more comfortably. These are extremely light weight and fit very well thanks to the toe box. They are made for running but for me they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Herbert

customer_reviews.title: Was so happy with the first pair I don't think I'll be ...
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of Altra I have purchased. Was so happy with the first pair I don't think I'll be buying any other brand shoes anymore. Product has made me a raving fan.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Uhlig

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable running shoe
customer_reviews.text: It’s the first I broke away from Nike or Adidas for running shoes and these are by far away a much more comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan G Thomason

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These shoes feel more like slippers. I've had the Paradigm 1 and 2 and these feel just as good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Poe

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is very comfortable for people with wide feet. Love the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Don Dilla

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For in Altra!!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing. There will be no more Nike, Reebok, Adidas, New Balance, or any other shoe that will go on my feet except Altra. The most comfortable, light-weight shoe out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Men in Black Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Could be better if wider, but overall comfort is excellent
customer_reviews.author: Timothy E. O'Neal

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Utility: Very comfortable for long hours of walking ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality: Very Good Utility: Very comfortable for long hours of walking or running
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My wife bought these for her work as an RN ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought these for her work as an RN. She loves them but order 1 size larger than you normally wear.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Diaz

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOE
customer_reviews.text: Unlike any shoe I've ran in. My new all time favorite.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: good shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love the wide toe box and the zero drop.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: The more expensive ones I bought I still wear them with no problem
customer_reviews.text: Heel support is giving away I have to use a shoe horn to get them on after 3 months
customer_reviews.author: Carol V. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: order them a full size bigger than your normal shoe size
customer_reviews.text: Awesome running shoes. Put 10 miles on them right out of the box. Perfect for me
customer_reviews.author: Jon Neumann

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Feels like I'm walking on air. I won't buy anything other than Altra going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am hooked on ALTRA running shoes...what else can I say...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cush!
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe, for me it hit all the spots!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ran in this shoe for many months - my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Salge

customer_reviews.title: I've purchased several pair of Paradigm because I have a ...
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several pair of Paradigm because I have a wide foot. The 3 is narrower and more restrictive than the others.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gude

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, excellent cushion. Perfect for longer or recovery runs
customer_reviews.author: Michael Risk

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are the best shoes for my feet and back.
customer_reviews.author: Maxi

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: He is very happy. His feet doesn't hurt when he runs anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Lesa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, very “cushy” and comfortable. ordered a 1/2 size larger than usual. Seller was great with exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: The large toe box was the first thing I noticed, it made it feel so much more comfortable than my other shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth N Watford

customer_reviews.title: Plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Great zero drop shoe for Plantar fasciitis. My favorite pair by far
customer_reviews.author: Samuel L Prifogle

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shoes but Disappointing Finishes
customer_reviews.text: I love Altra shoes. The zero-drop heels basically cured my Plantar Fasciitis. These shoes are holding up well but the finishes are wearing off after only a month. I wouldn't complain too much but I paid $140 for these shoes and my expectations are higher. I workout about 5x/week at a gym and have included photos next to some 3 year old Asics that are in better shape than the one month old Altras Paradigm 3.0s. Seems like the finish issue would have came out in any testing that was done prior to a release, as I am not pounding out 40+miles a week or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Metallman9

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Roomy and good cushion. I have plantar fasciitis and these help.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I'm coming from the Torin 2.0 and wanted something with just a little more cushion and stability. These are awesome. I immediately noticed that certain soreness in my lower legs that I'd usually expect after a run is completely gone. The fit is as expected. I was already a huge fan of Altra shoes, using them for hiking, running, and even casual day purposes. Now I'm even more of a disciple of the zero drop gospel.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Order 1/2 size larger
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 1/2 size larger than I normally wear. I have run Hokas for a couple of years now. I was warned that I would experience some lower leg discomfort initially....and I did. Nothing horrible and it resolved after a week. I haven't done over a 12 mile run in them yet but no problems. Similar feel to Hokas.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: I started hiking with the altra Olympus 2.0 last summer after my old brand cause the loss of both tour nails on my descent of mount defiance. Worn them ever since. I stand on concrete at work all day. I suffered from major foot pain. I then got my altra mens 3.0 running shoe and all my foot pain went away. There is only one thing i don't like about the shoe is the glued on tread pads come off but i fixed that with some good super glue as they started too lift up. I would recommend altra shoes to everyone. I won't ever buy another shoe!!!!
customer_reviews.author: pete hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Comfort is OK and Performance is ok too.
customer_reviews.text: Comfort is OK and Performance is ok too. These are OK shoes. I'll keep them and use them and even enjoy them. They are, in my book, not a Wow! Up date: The heal of the left shoe broke down after about 60 days of use. I now have a bulge in the left heal making the shoe very uncomfortable. Avery expensive piece of crap shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Mort

customer_reviews.title: Returned. Does not fit the same as the Paradigm ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned. Does not fit the same as the Paradigm 2.0. Much tighter across instep. Tongue is much thicker and free floating. Tongue doesn't stay in place, it kept sifting toward outside. Other Altra all have a tongue connected to shoe for 1/2 its length to ensure it stays in place. Not sure what they were thinking to do free floating tongue.
customer_reviews.author: Mapman

customer_reviews.title: Walking around the house after these arrived I felt like I was at the local discount shoe store
customer_reviews.text: Walking around the house after these arrived I felt like I was at the local discount shoe store, the stores where you self serve shoes off the racks. Very unlike my previous experience with Altra's.
customer_reviews.author: Boydo

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide kid foot
customer_reviews.text: Inner foot is very narrow. If you have a wife mid foot avoid this shoe. Otherwise it's a great shoe for impact obdorbstion.
customer_reviews.author: Vettel

product_meta.title: ALTRA Men's Paradigm 3 Running Shoe, Red, 8 UK
product_meta.description: The Altra Paradigm 3.0's new GuideRail feature will help steer your foot when you get off track, while the upper has been revamped with an all-new super sweet mesh and bunion window for a great fit no matter your foot shape. The unchanged max cushion 32 mm stack height coupled with the perfect mix of support when you need it and not when you don't, will keep you comfortable for the long haul. This is a versatile, hardworking shoe that's great for tired feet or if you just need a little extra support for the long run.
feature_bullets: DESIGNED TO IMPROVE: Natural Foot Positioning, Toe Splay, Comfort
PLATFORM: Fully cushioned Zero Drop platform and FootShape toe box. CUSHIONING: High. STACK HEIGHT: 32mm. LAST: SD5-M
MIDSOLE: Dual layer EVA with A-Bound. OUTSOLE: FootPod outsole. INSOLE: 5mm Sculpted Footbed. UPPER: Quick-dry Air Mesh
OTHER FEATURES: Natural Ride System, GuideRail Support Feature
IDEAL USES: Road Running, Trail Running, Fitness, Cross-Training. WEIGHT: 10.3oz/292g
